attributes.action: Make food company’s guarantee products are free from allergens
attributes.additional_details: More and more company’s are choosing to put “may contain...” on their packaging instead of increasing food hygiene and preventing cross-contamination. Everday foods such as bread, noodles, cereals, crisps can all be seen declaring they “may contain nuts” when clearly these foods should not.
attributes.background: People who suffer from allergies should not have to ‘take a risk’ when eating foods which say they “may contain nuts” etc. Those who have allergies and avoid foods which declare a risk of allergens are becoming more limited to what they can eat due to company’s not guaranteeing their food is safe.
